gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players commandeer advanced airships to execute strategic missions aimed at restoring bee populations and habitats affected by natural disasters and human activities. Balancing immediate needs against long-term sustainability is crucial. Players' choices in-game affect global ecosystems, highlighting the desperate struggle of our most important pollinators: Bees.

blueTeam.name: Apis Aviators
blueTeam.description: Experts in native vegetation regeneration and bee rescue.

redTeam.name: Bombus Navigators
redTeam.description: Specialists in long-term bee conservation and sustainable ecosystem management.

turns.scenario: A Hurricane has caused significant damage to bee habitats. Teams must decide on the best recovery strategy.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones away from the hurricane's path.

AA.narrative: Both teams prioritize habitat recovery, planting native flowers across the region. Initial recovery is successful, but new threats arise from invasive species attracted to these new flowering zones.

AB.narrative: Apis Aviators focus on habitat recovery while Bombus Navigators ensure bee survival. Their combined efforts lead to a balanced recovery, pulling the bees back from the brink of disaster.

BA.narrative: Bombus Navigators work on habitat restoration while Apis Aviators create safe zones. The new colonies thrive, yet a scarcity of local nectar sources slows their progress.

BB.narrative: Both teams establish new colonies in safe zones. Bee numbers increase significantly, but the lack of suitable rehabituated areas limits their long-term survival.

turns.scenario: Wildfires have ravaged key bee-foraging territories. Teams must decide on their restoration strategy.

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to stimulate ecological recovery.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to maintain populative stability.

AA.narrative: Both teams plant bee-friendly vegetation. Recovering green spaces attract a host of wildlife. However, frequent patrols are required to safeguard these areas from resurging fires.

AB.narrative: Apis Aviators seed the burnt areas while Bombus Navigators create artificial habitats. This pairing leads to favorable outcomes as bees have new homes and ample food sources.

BA.narrative: Bombus Navigators seed the fire-stricken areas while Apis Aviators translocate bees. The relocated bees cope well, but the seeded areas will need time to bloom and become effective food sources.

BB.narrative: Both teams create artificial habitats. Bee numbers stabilize, but the artificial nature of these habitats results in lower genetic diversity, posing new challenges for the future.

turns.scenario: With the immediate crisis stabilized, teams need to create sustainable solutions for bee populations.

options.A: Develop advanced ecological technology to improve habitat conditions.
options.B: Launch a comprehensive educational campaign to increase public awareness and support for bee conservation.

AA.narrative: Both teams invest in ecological technology. New habitats become safe havens for bees. However, lack of public awareness limits wider conservation efforts.

AB.narrative: Apis Aviators develop ecological technologies while Bombus Navigators launch a public awareness campaign. Their joint efforts create an upsurge in local conservation efforts, leading to favorable outcomes.

BA.narrative: Bombus Navigators focus on technology while Apis Aviators raise awareness. The heightened awareness combined with technological advancement creates an environment that fosters bee population growth.

BB.narrative: Both teams focus on public education, and there is a notable increase in conservation efforts across the world. However, technology advancements could have given an extra boost.
